title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 February 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:24 <tmortagne> debugging  
10:25 <lyes> has joined #xwiki

10:44 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki

11:31 <vmassol> FYI the groovy project is looking at SFConservancy (since they have to move out of codehaus which is closing). Should be interesting to follow their discussion on their list  
11:32 <vmassol> http://markmail.org/message/4gj5tsnibkozzjiz (haven't read it yet)  
11:32 <vmassol> wrong thread  
11:32 <vmassol> actually it's the correct one but later  
11:33 <vmassol> (in the discussion)

15:08 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <msmeria> has quit  
15:44 <Bugen\_do> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <vmassol> hmm seems that functional  tests may have been broken by a change  
16:30 <vmassol> AdministrationPage administrationPage = page.clickAdministerWiki(); is not working anymore  
16:30 <vmassol> that calls at org.xwiki.test.ui.po.BasePage.toggleTopMenu(BasePage.java:344)  
16:30 <vmassol> and the problem is that this xpath is no longer valid:  
16:30 <vmassol> Unable to locate element: {"method":"xpath","selector":"//li[@id='tmWiki']//a[contains(@class, 'dropdown-split-right')]"}  
16:31 <vmassol> has someone changed something related to this recently?  
16:31 <vmassol> evalica, gdelhumeau?  
16:31 <gdelhumeau> I'l take a look  
16:31 <gdelhumeau> maybe caused by the new bootstrap  
16:32 <gdelhumeau> unless it has appeared afterwards  
16:33 <evalica> anyway - the 'tmWiki' selector can be located only in subwikis, not on the mainwiki  
16:33 <vmassol> these tests have always worked  
16:33 <vmassol> and they're on the main wiki  
16:35 <vmassol> tmWiki is there that's not the problem  
16:35 <vmassol> seems the class is dropdown-toggle  
16:36 <evalica> it contains also the dropdown-split-right  
16:36 <vmassol> I don't see that in my browser  
16:36 <evalica> <a href="#" class="dropdown-split-right dropdown-toggle hidden-xs " data-toggle="dropdown">  
16:36 <vmassol> I see this: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/0b50e05be74ecaaf6719/raw/06dec7cba58686a37733dabb2e1ee2815c69da03/gistfile1.txt  
16:37 <gdelhumeau> oh yes I have it locally  
16:38 <gdelhumeau> did you have this result with DOM inspector?  
16:38 <vmassol> chrome dev tools  
16:38 <vmassol> wdym by "I have it locally"?  
16:39 <evalica> http://hastebin.com/xonuyijeza.xml  
16:39 <vmassol> caty this is not my use case  
16:39 <vmassol> my use is main wiki  
16:39 <evalica> I have it also on main wiki  
16:39 <vmassol> and in a stripped down XE (the one we use in funct tests)  
16:41 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I have dropdown-split-right like evalica on my local instance (6.4.1)  
16:41 <gdelhumeau> so it should not come from bootstrap  
16:42 <gdelhumeau> hmm  
16:42 <vmassol> can you try running the xwiki-platform-mail functional tests? I'm on master btw  
16:42 <vmassol> what's strange is that ci.xwiki.org seems to work  
16:42 <vmassol> but I don't see how this could be a local issue  
16:43 <evalica> my instance was also 6.4.1  
16:47 <vmassol> wait  
16:47 <vmassol> testing something  
16:48 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I'm running it and I have dropdown-split-righ  
16:48 <vmassol> It's my fault and it's local  
16:48 <vmassol> sorry for the trouble  
16:48 <vmassol> what happened is that I cd-ed into the wrong directory to start XE  
16:49 <gdelhumeau> but the build does not pass  
16:49 <vmassol> and I didn't notice I was in xwiki-platform-mail-send/xwiki-platform-mail-send-test  
16:49 <vmassol> instead of  
16:49 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-mail-test  
16:49 <vmassol> so I executed an old XE actually
